availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Alexander Kimbrough (Harrison County, Kentucky, farm laborer and soldier)

body.p: Harrison County, Kentucky, farm laborer and soldier. Kentucky native. Son of John M. Kimbrough and Susan Kimbrough. Resident of Harrison County, Kentucky, in 1850. Household owned six enslaved persons in Harrison County in 1850. Farm laborer in Harrison County in 1860. Household owned seven enslaved persons in Harrison County in 1860. Household also held two enslaved persons in trust for minor heirs in Harrison County in 1860. Served in the 4th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry (U.S.A.) as a sergeant from October 9, 1861 to December 6, 1864. Wounded at the Battle of Chickamauga, Georgia. Discharged for medical disability on December 6, 1864.
